text:
hello, i tried to use the api of subscribe on the sandbox and it went well and when i published it on production and i used live version, i got the i can’t subscribe the user programmatically
Subscription XXXXXXXX for email_address cannot be updated because they have unsubscribed
Following. Maybe try to reach out to <mailto:hs-subscriptions-core@hubinfra.com|hs-subscriptions-core@hubinfra.com>

Hi everyone,
I'm working on setting up an automated workflow in HubSpot and need some assistance. Here’s what I’m trying to achieve:
1. *HubSpot App Creation*: I’ve created a HubSpot app and set up a webhook within it.
2. *Workflow Trigger*: I’ve configured a workflow that triggers whenever a new deal is created.
3. *Data Transfer*: The goal is to automatically capture data from the newly created deal and send it to our system using a HubSpot POST API.
However, I’m running into an issue where the URL seems to be invalid, and I’m not receiving any response when testing the webhook in Postman.
Has anyone set up something similar or can guide me on how to properly configure this workflow so that it automatically retrieves data when a deal is created on the website? Any insights or steps to troubleshoot this would be greatly appreciated!
Thanks in advance!

Hello everyone,

i tried to work with a sandbox from <http://app-eu1.HubSpot.com|app-eu1.HubSpot.com>.
I need to open my firewall policy like that:
<http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com>'s sandbox => my firewall => my intern api.

My question is: do you have any infos about which FQDN or wildcard i can use ?
I'll not open like ALL => My intern API :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

ty for infomations !
PS: i tried *.<http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com> & *.<http://hubapi.com|hubapi.com> but it doesn't work. When i check the request, it comes from something like 143.244.84.0/22 (not everytime).
<@U07FDUMUMA5> any idea ?
We would love this too.

Hello!

Im working on implementing some of the new properties `hs_v2_date_entered_{stage_id}` that were recently announced here
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/upcoming-sunset-of-pipeline-legacy-stage-calculated-properties-for-contacts-and-deals>

However this part caught my eye:
> _Note: the {stage_id} value in the property names above may exactly match the stage ID on the pipeline stage, or it may be altered slightly to conform to property naming rules._
Knowing that `stage_id` are really an "anything goes field" as I've seen numbers, uuids,  strings w/ spaces, hyphens and slashes etc in them.
Is there anywhere documents the criteria used to transform an stage id to a property?

Thanks in advance!

Hi everyone!
Sorry if my question was already here, but I could not find the answer.
I understand that storing IP addresses in contacts was removed (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Sunset-IP-addresses-will-be-sunset-from-all-HubSpot-APIs-on-May/m-p/253124>)
I create contacts via the basic API this way: `api_client.crm.contacts.basic_api.create(body: contact_body).` Is it still possible to set attributes like IP country, IP city, etc.? These fields are read-only.
Is it possible to send the IP address in some other way, not store it, but just use it to fill out these attributes?

ResponseRequest


*Testing results include invalid JSON*
Select up to 20 fields from the webhook response to output that can be used in later actions in the workflow.

Hey <@U07JVV2FEUA> :wave:

This is stuff that I have used I think, do you want a quick call to figure that out ? It's probably going to be easier than with few text information :slightly_smiling_face:

This is what I've gotten so far:

• Hyphens become underscores `-` -> `_`
• upcase letters become downcase `ABC` -> `abc`
• spaces or non ascii characters are removed `a b` -> `ab` && `a/b` -> `ab`
• But then sometimes a random number is suffixed at the end. `hello world` -> `hs_v2_date_entered_helloworld_123456`
Where that last number comes from is a complete mystery to me :upside_down_face:

Today I had some inconsistent behavior when searching for a contact by email using the Python SDK versus calling the API endpoint directly.

The question I have is to determine if the Python library is able to search `hs_additional_emails`

The Python library returns no results where as when making a POST request to to `/crm/v3/objects/contacts/search` results are returned.

Hoping the community here can provide some insight on this behavior.

Hi team, does anyone know how I can go from a record in the owners api to a user? The problem I'm having is that calling `/crm/v3/owners/` gives me a record with a `userId`, but calling `/crm/v3/objects/users` with that user id gives me a `404`
Do you have a custom object called users?
The owners endpoint is a HubSpot defined endpoint to enable you to get all users from your HubSpot Account.   You can then use the IDs provided to update any property which is of type "HubSpot user"
I'd need to know what your use case is in order help point you in the right direction.

Hi Team, hoping someone can point me in the right direction here.
Would it possible to use the HubSpot api to update the access group membership to control access to some content.

Some background, We want to use membership pages to control access to particular pages for certain contacts. So the hope is once some external conditions are met we can use the API to add the contact to the access group that has access to the content

Hello everyone,
Is there a way to save data in HubDB after submitting the form in HubSpot?
Please share the documentation of that API with me.
Hi! I've been working with deals but I need to automate the creation of invoices from deals? Is it possible?

Hi Everyone!
Hope you can help me :slightly_smiling_face:
I’m developing a Public HubSpot App that should analyze the recordings of calls made in HubSpot.
I have the call ID and I can fetch the information needed from HubSpot.
I also need to download to recording video in order to complete the analysis.
How can I fetch locally the call recording?
